medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began 8 months postoperatively after a squamous cell carcinoma surgery. The patient initially had an interalveolar distance of only 0.5 cm and experienced a worsening condition due to severe periodontitis and insufficient oral hygiene. After surgery, intraoperative stretching was done, achieving a maximum mouth opening of 35 mm.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a history of squamous cell carcinoma of the palate and severe submucous fibrosis due to more than 20 years of betel nut chewing. He also presents with severe periodontitis.
medical_history.social_history: The patient has a history of chewing betel nut for over 20 years.
